author: sky.cactus
content:
<@552133098075193354> In my latest PR I changed some variable names per requests and previous discussions.  I went with the ultra verbose and specific:
`max_fee_per_gas` (previously `fee_cap_per_gas`)
`max_inclusion_fee_per_gas` (previously `max_miner_bribe`)
`inclusion_fee_per_gas` (previously `effective_miner_bribe`)
`effective_gas_price` (what `GASPRICE` opcode is set to)
We never did settle on a name, but I think those ones were generally positively received and `bribe` has gotten a lot of hate (and I have been convinced it isn't accurate).

author: timbeiko
content: Good feedback from the mining channel. What do people think about updating the EIP rationale related to the burning of the base fee?

author: sky.cactus
content: EIPs are technical standards.  It is not appropriate to include arguments in them at all.

author: sky.cactus
content: (if such exist now, we should probably remove them)

author: sky.cactus
content: Motivation section is a bit of an exception, as we usually allow some *very high level* statements about why someone would want to implement the EIP.  However, it isn't meant to be a constantly updating arguments for/against.
